title: Serious Suggestions to Balance Jinx's Kit (NOT a "GG GUT JNX" post)
body:
Lately I have seen a LOT of posts here from players frustrated at Jinx's excessive power. They aren't wrong. But just because she can 1v2 her lane, split push, reduce the population of a teamfight from 10 to 5 in 4.7 seconds flat, and get a pentakill in baron bit from bot inhibitor, doesn't mean she needs the treatment of: 

Nerf into oblivion --> Slowly add strength back to over the course of 4 patches --> Ignore for eternity because nobody plays them anymore

^This is the kind of approach to champions that has shattered the playerbase and the manner in which the game is played. 

All she needs is -50 range on her rockets max rank, -15% attack speed from her minigun at max stacks, and less movement speed from her passive. 

**THAT'S IT**

The only reason people complain about her is that she is too safe. You force her to put herself into sticky situations and, like magic, all your cares disappear.

replies.body: How about instead of nerfing jinx directly we buff her lane counters, as an indirect nerf.

The thing about Jinx is that even if she gets countered all she has to do is farm just outside her tower and wait for a gank or until late game. Buffing her lane counters does nothing for her late game scaling.

>
> The thing about Jinx is that even if she gets countered all she has to do is farm just outside her tower and wait for a gank or until late game. Buffing her lane counters does nothing for her late game scaling.

Riot has said she's supposed to be a late game hypercarry.  They want her late game scaling too be good if teams don't get in her face and keep her from farming.

I wasn't trying to say that her being a hypercarry is bad, just that she is waaayyy too good at it. Her tower pushing potential is RIDICULOUS but that would be okay if she weren't also able to deal aoe crits at 700 range.

> [{quoted}](name=HeraldOfDemacia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VAdpArMo,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2015-05-08T17:40:53.688+0000)
>
> I wasn't trying to say that her being a hypercarry is bad, just that she is waaayyy too good at it. Her tower pushing potential is RIDICULOUS but that would be okay if she weren't also able to deal aoe crits at 700 range.

Why does everyone who can't beat Jinx blame the AOE crits?  I mean unless your team is all standing in a really tight circle she can't hit everyone, and trust me a full build Jinx doesn't need an AOE crit to waveclear like a champ.  That's probably my biggest issue with everyone screaming "OMG, Jinx OP, NERF!"  She's not hard to beat if you know how to fight her.  Don't group in a little ball she can use her rockets on, and do all you can to dive her.  Jinx can do a lot of damage if she's using her minigun, but a good tank will wreck her if they initiate on her.  (especially if they have thornmail. - put Thornmail on Volibear, Amumu or Maokai when they have a decent build and they can 1v1 Jinx.)

I don't take issue with the aoe crit part as much as the 700 range part. Thats more than Cait and she only gets an auto buff every what 7 attacks? If the range were reduced on the rockets then she can crit on every shot for all I care.
You want Graves to be buffed? What?

i find slows in this game are op. and her w has a sick slow. cant' ever reach her as a melee with no gap closer. as warwick even with e up i can't even come close to her (assuming my ult is down). 
Zap Slow = 30 / 40 / 50 / 60 / 70%

its insane bra. 

sure its a skill shot. idk i just find slow destroys movementspeed. Its pretty hard to get movementspeed too. I feel like bonus move speed should also give % slow resist. this would include spells too like karma shield kayle heal etc.
warwick's bloodscent when a nearby enemy is low should have some % slow resist on it. i can't barely notice it since slows shut down movement speed buffs so much. Movementspeed isn't exactly easy to comeby either. 
not to mention adcs are range and can kite/studder step.
The thing about Jinx's slow is that it is a skillshot with a small slender hotbox. If you have tier one boots or any kind of dash ability then you'll be fine.

>
> The thing about Jinx's slow is that it is a skillshot with a small slender hotbox. If you have tier one boots or any kind of dash ability then you'll be fine.

The hitbox isn't THAT small.  Not sure how wide, but wide enough that it isn't THAT tough to hit, especially early when she's trading/harassing.  But it's ridic that the thing has a LONGER range than "sniper" Caitlyn's skillshot and has the same range as "annoying as hell" Nidalee's skillshot, but with a slow tacked on just for giggles.  Her problem (like a lot of the newer champions) is that her toxic kit is overloaded.

> [{quoted}](name=Mahou Girl Mami,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VAdpArMo,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2015-05-08T14:17:39.522+0000)

But it's ridic that the thing has a LONGER range than "sniper" Caitlyn's skillshot and has the same range as "annoying as hell" Nidalee's skillshot, but with a slow tacked on just for giggles.  Her problem (like a lot of the newer champions) is that her toxic kit is overloaded.

Jinx's W?  It gives you plenty of warning due to the very visible target line on the ground.  If you can't dodge it then you aren't paying attention.  It's probably one of the easiest bot lane skill shots to avoid.

Her kit wouldn't be overloaded if she weren't able to stand halfway across the map from a teamfight and fire aoe crits into the fight. Yes her slow can be annoying, but if she didn't have it then she would be basically worthless. 

Think about it: Ashe has an aoe slow that deals damage, graves has an aoe damage skill shot and a dash to make up for its lack of cc, varus has an aoe slow and a long range damage ability. Tristana makes up for her lack of a long range damage skillshot with a long range jump (even though she isn't that great right now and would be if she had a skillshot imo). 

Besides, the slow has a long telegraphed cast. If you decrease her range and movespeed from her passive, then it will be all too easy to jump her if she tries using it.

> [{quoted}](name=HeraldOfDemacia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VAdpArMo,comment-id=0001000000010000,timestamp=2015-05-08T14:24:15.634+0000)

Tristana makes up for her lack of a long range damage skillshot with a long range jump (even though she isn't that great right now and would be if she had a skillshot imo). 
> 

Ashe's slow (freezing) is HER whole identity, Caitlyn's long range is HER whole identity in both cases, THAT is what they're built around.  The only reason Jinx doesn't "break" Ashe is because Ashe can use her freeze on basic aa, but she can out harass Cait if she wants.  Tristana has a long range jump.  In the tank meta that's not "good" since it basically just means I can trade the ability to hit their adc for getting gang-banged by everyone.  And THAT is if you're lucky and don't get cc'ed by SOMEONE who can break your jump.  Oh, and look, Jinx's chompers just HAPPEN to have the same range as Tristana's jump. (compare to Caitlyn's "**Yordle** Snap Trap" which is NARROWER and has 100 less range)

Part of it IS the Tank Meta, Jinx would be weaker in an assassin meta, but she's still the most ridic ADC with way too much versatility.
I'm not suggesting that every adc in game is in a wonderful place right now because most of them aren't, but I am saying that Jinx is fine with her slow, not with the insane Q.

> [{quoted}](name=HeraldOfDemacia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VAdpArMo,comment-id=000100000001000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-08T14:56:17.494+0000)
>
> I'm not suggesting that every adc in game is in a wonderful place right now because most of them aren't, but I am saying that Jinx is fine with her slow, not with the insane Q.

I actually agree that her "Zap" isn't the big problem.  And I ALSO agree that her overloaded Q IS a big problem.  I'm just saying they stacked way too many abilities in her kit.  As a Tristana main, I HATE that her Q basically contains BOTH Tristana's original passive AND her Q, plus half her E.  The fact that they then gave her Caitlyn's Q, but longer range and with a slow and sight (Ashe abilities), tacked on Caitlyn's W but made it wider and longer, add in a variation on MF/Sivir's passive, and Ezreal's ult.  They basially took DEFINING abilities from several champs and shoved them all into one kit.

I'm saying nerf ANY one of her abilities and she's STILL a strong pick that can at LEAST contend with the champ(s) that her remaining kit is based on, if not more.  Put a 20 sec cooldown on her Q swap (like Tristana's rapid fire) OR put a time limit+cooldown on her rockets.  If at least ONE of the abilities on Q was "gated" then maybe she'd actually have to use strategy and THINK about using them.

I definitely see what you're saying. Miss Fortune is actually my favorite adc and I have my only penta kills on her so I can definitely understand your pain. They won't gate her Q with cooldowns though because that would make her less of an adc (sustained dps and all that) and also because she's the starchild of Riot. I also think a lot of the reason they won't do anything is because with the new tank meta she isn't as much of a problem against tanky teams because BotRK doesn't work all that well on her because she outranges the active and has enough attack speed from her Q.

If 3 people jump on one person though then they should drop pretty quickly, and she does as long as her chompers are on cd or if you just walk around them.
